channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big Pharma Cuts R&D, Sending Shudders Through Industry
item.description: Results from Charles River Laboratories, a provider of drug-discovery services to pharma companies, signal an era of cost cutting.

item.title: Here’s what has to happen for Nvidia’s price to be justified, says the dean of valuation
item.description: Nvidia’s AI business can’t justify a $3 trillion valuation — but here’s what can, says a NYU finance professor.

item.title: Goldman Sachs Wants to Be a Bigger Lender. It's Asking Insurance Companies For Help.
item.description: A big push into asset-backed loans is part of the bank’s plan to roughly double its private-credit assets in the next five years.

item.title: BP downgraded on concerns over stock buyback ability
item.description: BP saw a broker downgrade on Thursday after analysts said its stock buyback is less sustainable than rival integrated oil companies.

item.title: A Slowing Economy's Silver Lining: Cheaper Gas
item.description: Fears of a slowdown and the summer whiplash in financial markets have dragged oil prices to their lowest level in months.

item.title: Oil prices edge lower after back-to-back gains
item.description: Oil futures were off slightly early Thursday, consolidating after back-to-back gains.

item.title: These Stock Picks Were No Ticket to Paradise
item.description: Losing stocks outweighed the seven columnist picks that beat the S&P 500 during Heard on the Street’s annual stock-picking contest.

item.title: ‘He does not manage his own bills’: My brother is about to take Social Security. Should we put his inheritance from our father’s estate into an annuity?
item.description: “My other brother, who understands finances much better than me, says no one likes annuities.”

item.title: Office Loans Are Toxic. Apartment Loans Could End Up Worse.
item.description: Distress rates are rising for a type of loan that apartment flippers feasted on during the pandemic.

item.title: In a stock-market meltdown, this retirement-account trick can save you thousands in taxes
item.description: But too few people know about it, or do it.
